question: Jared Nomak? Hi. We're ready for you now. I see from your questionnaire that you don't have any immediate next of kin?
answer: Not that I'm in contact with.

question: Nobody to call in case of an emergency?
answer: No -- Does that mean I can't be a donor?

question: It depends. We came up with some unusual results on your blood test.
answer: How unusual?

question: Your blood has a very rare phenotype, one that's quite valuable to people like us.
answer: Us? What are you talking about? Vampires -- I fucking hate vampires.

question: exits just behind them, eschewing the stairs completely and vaulting over the railing. He unholsters his MACH pistol as he drops, FIRING it as he lands in a cat-like stance on the snowy ground below --
answer: Running like a bull, condensed vapor streaming from his mouth and nostrils. Splashing through puddles of icy water storming through barriers of plywood and razor wire, leaping over mountains of garbage bags.

question: Bursts from the factory. Segura revs his BMW, trying to run him down. At the last second, Blade pivots aside like a matador. Segura circles around for another try.
answer: as he snaps his hand up -- a trio of Japanese throwing stars appearing between his fingers like a magician's cards. He flings the stars at Jigsaw's bike --

question: Fuck me!
answer: You going to stand there crapping your pants or are you going to help me?!

question: You got something in mind, Blade?
answer: Ultra-rapid detox. They use it on heroin addicts, make 'em go cold-turkey in one night. Gonna try and OD Whistler on a retroviral cure.

question: I don't know about this, man --
answer: Get back!!! If there's anything of you left in there, Whistler, listen up now. Come morning, those shutters are going up. Either you'll be cured, or you'll fry. It's going to be a long night.

question: Get back!!! If there's anything of you left in there, Whistler, listen up now. Come morning, those shutters are going up. Either you'll be cured, or you'll fry. It's going to be a long night.
answer: Daylight. Son of a bitch.

question: How do you feel?
answer: Like a fucking heifer took a dump in my mouth. You came back for me.

question: Did you think I wouldn't?
answer: Took you long enough.

question: Let's just hope you've kicked the Thirst for good. I'll be watching you close. You start to back-slide --
answer: You put a bullet in my brain. Wouldn't expect anything else. I'll say one thing for doing time as a suckhead. Seems to have knocked that cancer of mine back into remission. Where the hell's my lathe?

question: You put a bullet in my brain. Wouldn't expect anything else. I'll say one thing for doing time as a suckhead. Seems to have knocked that cancer of mine back into remission. Where the hell's my lathe?
answer: Whistler. Cool beans. Nice to meet you, man. Heard a lot. I'm Josh Frohmeyer. You can call me Scud, though. That's what most people do.

question: Tell me something, Skid --
answer: Scud.

question: Whatever -- What'd you do to the Charger?
answer: The pimp-mobile? Just made a few after market modifications. Nitrous-oxide injection system, forged aluminum pistons and crankshaft, higher flowing fuel pump.

question: Gave it a more aggressive exhaust profile ramping.
answer: Fuck yeah. Whole package'll crank this betty up another three-hundred horsepower.

question: And you'll burn the damn thing out before your next fucking oil change. Where'd you dig up this shit-bird anyway?
answer: Look, what's your problem?

question: My problem, shitbird, is that I tried to blow my fucking head off and wound up sucking blood clots for the last year and a half! Now you're standing there choking your chicken like we're all walking around some fucking candy-ass vampire sitcom!
answer: Hey, you think I don't know what's at stake here? We practically compromised our whole operation to save your puckered old ass! And for what?

question: Our operation?! Our operation?! I built this operation, you fucking turd stain.
answer: Motion sensors. Looks like Zone Three.

question: If you girls are finished flirting, I'd like to get started. Didn't I kill you already?
answer: That was my sister.

question: This the part where you beat your chest and vow revenge?
answer: Something like that.

question: Chupa, Asad, Snowman and Priest. THREE SHADOWED FIGURES are lurking near one of the exits -- skinhead types, each with a hairline scar running down their chin. Asad silently motions to snowman and the others, indicating figures. Snowman signs something back. The vampire trio starts towards them.
answer: Um, Whistler, you out there? Whistler?
speaker1: INT. HOUSE OF PAIN - BALLROOM - NIGHT

question: As the music reaches a crescendo, Asad notices MORE SHADOWY FIGURES by another exit. And even MORE by a third. Snowman signs to Asad again, more urgently this time, as the first potential Reaper begins to turn and we are -- The first skinhead figure spins towards us. It's a Reaper. All three of them are, eyes wide with bloodlust as they leap at Asad and the others.
answer: They're here!!!!
speaker1: INT. HOUSE OF PAIN - BALLROOM - NIGHT

question: Chaos. Vampire patrons flee. The Bloodpack FIRE, unleashing a hailstorm of bullets, cutting into vampires and Reapers alike as --
answer: UV headlights, c'mon, come on!!! FuckmefuckmefuckmeFUCKME!!!!
speaker1: INT. HOUSE OF PAIN - BALLROOM - NIGHT

question: The Reaper nearest Priest turns in his direction. We recognize her as the Nurse from the bloodbank. She LEAPS at Priest --
answer: Use your entry lights! They can't stand the UV!!!
speaker1: INT. HOUSE OF PAIN - BALLROOM - NIGHT

question: You're hurt.
answer: I'll heal.

question: What about Nomak?
answer: He escaped. You didn't tell me they were immune to silver and garlic.

question: I didn't know.
answer: We lose anybody?

question: Ran into a little Reaper trouble myself.
answer: Oh yeah? Like how little? In case you hadn't noticed, we lost two men while you were out farting around.

question: You need to ratchet those 'nads of yours down a few notches, paco.
answer: Listen, hillbilly, you are a cunt-hair away from cowboy heaven.

question: Yes?
answer: They've made contact with the Reapers.

question: Any casualties?
answer: Two so far.

question: An inevitability, I suppose. Nyssa was not among them, I trust.
answer: No. This is a dangerous game, you're playing, Damaskinos.

question: Any game worthy of being played is. One must be patient. In this way, I have outlived my enemies. All of them.
answer: Blade's too volatile. You're not going to be able to keep manipulating him --

question: You worry too much, Stevens. I have assurance from our friend inside that events are unfolding as scripted.
answer: As scripted? You've already lost two of your own. How many more are you willing to sacrifice?

question: Recognize him?
answer: From the surveillance footage in the bloodbank. He was one of the guard's Nomak attacked.

question: Which means he turned about seventy-two hours ago.
answer: Right. So why is he dying? He doesn't appear to have any broken bones, no entry wounds of any kind -- what's killing him?

question: Time. No hemoglobin left. Their metabolisms are too fast. They burn out. That's why they're having to feed so often. Their systems are self destructing.
answer: If that's true, what about Nomak? He's been alive longer than the others.

question: Nomak's different. He's the carrier. There's something driving him beyond the Thirst. Something we're missing.
answer: They appear to have a nictating membrane here, like you'd see on a crocodile or camel. Shields the eyes from sunlight. A bifurcated mandible. More developed masseter muscles and zygomatic bones around the mouth allowing for a much larger, stronger bite -- Epidermal layers are thicker, tougher --

question: You've seen what we're up against. Daylight's the only advantage we've got. They'll be more vulnerable then.
answer: And so will we.

question: Look, I care about the humans who are dying, not you, got it?
answer: Spare me the race card, OJ. We're not going out into the sun. It's too risky.

question: You don't have a choice. You're just going to have to protect yourselves as best you can.
answer: You buying any of this chocolate Elvis bullshit?

question: You ask me, you and Miss Muffet are getting a mite too cozy for my taste.
answer: I wouldn't worry about it.

question: I am worrying. Seems to me, you're starting to get confused as to which side of the line you're standing on.
answer: Pretty hollow words coming from a man who spent the last year running with the enemy.

question: What the hell is that supposed to mean?
answer: It means I'm starting to wonder if the vampires still have their hooks in you. You've been acting strange ever since I gave you the cure. Reckless, quick to anger -- You said it yourself, Whistler. Those vampires knew our defense system backwards and forwards. Where'd they get their intel?

question: I'm compromised?! Me?! I'm not the one playing stink-finger with Vampirella out there!
answer: You're out of line, old man.

question: The hell are you fiddling with there?
answer: Tweaked the phosphor rod, modified the collimated beam, wanna concentrate the light, get something like a UV laser going.

question: You're wasting your time, already been tried.
answer: Yeah, but you didn't have the Scudster working on it, did you?

question: Nope. Back then we did not.
answer: So how long have you known Blade, anyway?

question: Going on twenty years now.
answer: Blade doesn't talk about the old days much.

question: Blade doesn't talk about anything much. What about you, though? Pretty.
answer: I was backpacking. Hooked up with these two chicks who were off to see the Burning Man festival. We were gonna take "E", have ourselves a little freeball out in the desert. You know the riff, "Dear Penthouse, I never thought this would happen to me, but --" Anyway, halfway through our Three's Company marathon, Janet and Chrissy started taking chunks out of me. Woulda died too if Blade hadn't shown up and staked those mamacitas a new honeyhole. Things kinda fell in place after that. Took myself a few souvenirs, though. Mmm-mmm. Poppa's got a brand new bag. The powerpacks have a limited charge, maybe ten minutes of continuous use at most.

question: Give me the rest of the pheromones.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Verlaine's body is back there somewhere with the UV bomb. If you train your guns in that direction, you'll drive an opening in their ranks. I'll run for it. When the Reapers come after me, you make a break for it the other way.
answer: You won't make it.

question: Then I'll die trying, won't I?
answer: Blade.

question: Save it. I don't want to hear your words. Let's do this NOW!!!
answer: Bleeding and horribly burned despite Asad's sacrifice. Blade crouches, scooping her up into his arms.

question: She needs a hypertransfusion. NOW! Do you want to die? Then get your fucking team in gear.
answer: Each day is a little life.

question: What?
answer: "Each day is a little life. Every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death." Anyone else make it?

question: I don't think so.
answer: Thank you.

question: For what?
answer: It would've been easy for you to let me die back there today, but you didn't.

question: I wouldn't read too much into it. You don't want to go there.
answer: Why?

question: Because one of us is going to kill the other before this ends.
answer: It doesn't have to be like that. We don't have to be enemies.

question: Get real. I was useful to Damaskinos as long as the hunt was still on. Now that it's over, all bets are off.
answer: If that's true, then why'd you save me? Why do you hate us so much?

question: I am a hunter. A weapon. It's what I do. It's in my blood.
answer: Well it's in mine, too. I'm a pureblood. I wasn't turned. I was born this way. Just like you. Am I evil because I want to survive? What about a wolf? What about any predator? The only difference between you and me is that I made peace with who I was a long time ago. I'm not ashamed of what I am. You haven't been hunting us all these years. You've been hunting yourself. You're hurting me.

question: Pain cuts the deepest, isn't that what you said? Reminds you you're alive?
answer: What's going on?

question: He was here. Watching us.
answer: Nomak?

question: Well maybe I do. Your security's for shit, kid.
answer: Where the hell have you been?

question: Just out connecting a few dots. Bangin' some vampire chick. Kind of a faux pas in our line of work, wouldn't you say? Hope you double bagged it, at least.
answer: What's your problem, Whistler?

question: Why don't you ask your girlfriend? I did some checking on that Carter Stevens character. That familiar of theirs who claimed he was with the NIH? Turns out he used to work for them, but he doesn't anymore.
answer: Then who does he work for?

question: You?
answer: Stands in the entry way. Whistler is behind him, holding a gun to Nyssa. Scud is there, too. Start talking, bitch.

question: I don't know what you --
answer: Nomak! You created him!

question: Ohgodohgodohgod... Alright, alright. Yes, we did... PLEASE! PLEASE!!!
answer: Keep talking, Stevens. Tell me why.

question: My child -- I would hate to think you were losing your perspective. Who do you think God favors in the web? The spider or the fly?
answer: Nomak said something to Blade in Greek. Athelfiki singenia ex amato. Where did he learn that?

question: From his father, of course.
answer: You experimented on your own, son?

question: Nomak is still out there.
answer: True, but thanks to you, we know his weakness. We can keep him contained. It's just a matter of time before we hunt him down.

question: Too bad you're out of it.
answer: And why is that?

question: How does it look?
answer: Not good.

question: It won't be long now. I can already feel it burning inside me -- I don't want to become what Nomak was -- I can't. I want to die while I'm still vampire.
answer: What do you want me to do?
